com.usp.icmc.libraryController.model

Class Library

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.usp.icmc.libraryController.model.Library
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class Library
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    Class Library represents a library and manages users, books and rentals. As well as blacklisting late users and saving a representation of itself on the disk
    See Also:
    TimeController, Book, User

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Library(java.lang.String dataDirectory)
      Constructs a library that will use the directory specified to store its information

        Parameters:

      • getUser

        public User getUser(long id)
        Gets a user from its ID. Should be used in conjunction with doesUserExists(long)

        Example code: if (library.doesUserExist(id)){ user = library.getUser(id); }

        Parameters:
        id - the ID to be searched for
        Returns:
        the found user
        Throws:
        noUserFoundException - if the user was not found
        See Also:
        doesUserExists(long)

      • getUser

        Gets a user from its name Should be used in conjunction with doesUserExists(String)

        Parameters:
        name - the name to be searched for
        Returns:
        the found user
        Throws:
        noUserFoundException - if the user was not found
        See Also:
        doesUserExists(String)

      • borrowBook

        public boolean borrowBook(User user,
                          Book book)
        Borrow a book to a user if possible. will return false if the user cannot borrow the book for any reason
        Parameters:
        user - the user to receive the book
        book - the book to be borrowed
        Returns:
        true if the book was borrowed, false otherwise

      • returnBook

        public boolean returnBook(User user,
                          Book book)
        returns a book previously borrowed by user will return false if the user does not have the book
        Parameters:
        user - the user that has the book
        book - the book to be returned
        Returns:
        true if the user had the book and false if not
        See Also:
        User.hasBook(Book)

      • getBook

        public Book getBook(java.lang.String Author,
                    java.lang.String Title)
        Finds a book by Author and Title. Should be used in conjunction with (String, String) Example code: if (library.doesBookExist(author, title)){ book = getBook(author, title); }
        Parameters:
        Author - the author to be searched for
        Title - the tile to be searched for
        Returns:
        the found book
        Throws:
        noBookFoundException - if the book was not found
